title: Relationship Platform - Foundational Team
description: Foundational PoC for the development of a modern front-end UX called Relationship Platform, permitting Allstate agents to concurrently write business for multiple insurance products.

details.description: Selection for this role involved a two-stage process to determine suitability for pairing.
Methodology followed was eXtreme Programming (XP), pairing directly with experienced resources from Pivotal Labs and Allstate resources in Chicago.

Primary goal was to build foundational frameworks and components, to document standards and to provide ongoing leadership to 1 of the 5 product teams which will form following the completion of Phase 1.
Completion of stories (tracked through Pivotal Tracker). All development work strictly completed using TDD
To provide domain knowledge and support for Allstate insurance products, helping to shape foundational design outcomes
Participation in weekly IPMs (Iteration Planning Meetings), weekly team retros and periodic tech retros
React, Redux, Redux-Saga, Redux-Thunk, Jison (lexical parsing), Spring Boot, Java (v1.8), ES6/ES7 (Babel), Webpack, SASS, Netflix Zuul, Node scripts
Mac OS 10, Linux, Intellij, Cloud Foundry, Git, Github Enterprise, Jenkins, Nodejs, NPM, Pivotal Tracker, ScreenHero (remote pairing)
JUnit 4, Mockito, Jest, Enzyme

title: Discontinued Product Removal Support
description: Development of an AngularJS application based on a RESTful API providing the ability for Retail Analysts to discontinue products.

details.description: Technical leadership to resources in Belfast and onsite in Rhode Island.
Identification and allocation of project tasks.
Tracking of project tasks using a Kanban board with daily stand-ups.
Effective communication of technical solutions to both technical and non-technical members of the development team, to ensure ideas are received and understood by all.
Working directly with the Enterprise Architect to ensure that the application is scalable into the future.
Design of an authentication solution using SiteMinder.
Design of a resource based authorization solution to provide security services to an expanding collection of applications.
Identification of appropriate technologies to replace unsupported or aging frameworks. Design of AngularJS modules and establishment of standards
Creation of a build strategy to centralize all AngularJS modules enabling reuse between projects
Configuration of Maven plugins to output minified Javascript resources to be easily consumed within other AngularJS projects.
Inclusion of both client and server side testing frameworks as part of the build process.
Design of a suitable project structure to facilitate Maven build scripts, and to ensure that the hierarchy of projects as they exist in the SVN repository is manageable going forward.
Utilization of SonarQube to help assess the quality of the code base.
Travel onsite to work directly with the BA and to prototype screen layouts, and to liaise with onsite developers.
Mentoring of junior team members and an active involvement in code reviews.
Source Control and Configuration Management.
Java (v1.8), Spring (v4), Maven (v3), xStream, DHTMLX, AngularJS, Twitter Bootstrap (v3) with Less, JDBC (Spring Templates), myBatis, RESTful services, SQL, Unix/Linux (limited)
Eclipse, Weblogic, Oracle SQL Developer, Tortoise, Subversion, Tomcat
JUnit, Mockito, PowerMock, Jasmine, Karma (test runner)
